tasks.task: Planting Atlantic dill giant pumpkin seeds in a 4x4 container and preparing them for germination.
subtasks: Fill the container with moist potting soil.
Create a shallow hole in the soil using a finger.
Position the seed with the pointy end downward.
Bury the seed in the soil, ensuring it is covered.
Avoid pressing the soil tightly around the seed.
Water the soil surface lightly to maintain moisture.
Soak seeds in warm water prior to planting for hydration.
Transfer the seeded container to a germination station with a heat mat.
Cover the container and provide consistent warmth (78-80 degrees).
Expose the seedlings to grow light immediately upon emergence.
Monitor the development of the first true leaf.
Transfer seedlings to the garden after two weeks, when the first true leaf is established.
Position the plant to direct vine growth based on the first true leaf orientation.
